meanings.definition: In a manner that shows anger or disapproval through a frown or grimace.
meanings.sent1: She looked scowlingly at her brother when he broke her toy.
meanings.sent2: The teacher scowlingly asked the students to be quiet during the test.
meanings.sent3: The cat scowlingly watched as the dog stole its food.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered scowlingly in the sky, warning of heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: His face twisted scowlingly as he realized he had forgotten his keys again.

meanings.definition: With a facial expression that conveys displeasure or hostility.
meanings.sent1: The scowlingly man refused to help anyone in need.
meanings.sent2: She gave him a scowlingly look when he made a rude comment.
meanings.sent3: The scowlingly customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent4: The old house had a scowlingly appearance, making it seem unwelcoming.
meanings.sent5: The scowlingly expression on her face scared away the timid kitten.
